channel.title: Gqrx on Vacuum weblog from Edward Vielmetti
channel.description: Recent content in Gqrx on Vacuum weblog from Edward Vielmetti

item.title: GQRX based radio scanner with gqrx-scan
item.description: gqrx-scan is a Perl script that drives the remote control of the gqrx software defined radio receiver to turn it into a scanner and automated recording tool. The GQRX remote control protocol is well documented and fairly simple, which means that the bulk of the Perl script has to do with setting and getting options. You can drive your scanner from the GQRX configuration file, or you can monitor a specific band or range of frequencies.

item.title: W8UM 145.23 repeater for Sunday night net, 19 April 2015
item.description:
As seen with gqrx on my Mac.
The readout on the radio says 145.2169 Mhz instead of 145.2300 Mhz, I think that means the receiver has drifted 16.1 KHz from peak, or perhaps the listed frequency is not what I'm looking at.
